pullrequest.title: Back port the memory out-of-bound access issue for joint cfm

content.raw:
That case has been taken care [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/5792935b759996843afe140af2ffc046e2126fd1/deps/opende/src/joints/hinge.cpp#cl-182)  
The input `5` is the index for the extra row, when [`limot->fmax>0`](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/5792935b759996843afe140af2ffc046e2126fd1/deps/opende/src/joints/hinge.cpp#cl-59)  

I agree the loop counting up to `info->m` and then make the input index to [`limot.addLimot()`](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/5792935b759996843afe140af2ffc046e2126fd1/deps/opende/src/joints/hinge.cpp#cl-182) as a parameter on `m`  

The reason here is, I am not sure whether `getInfo2` is guaranteed to be called after `getInfo1`, if not, that would be a failure.
